text: {"grade": 1, "reasoning": "The criterion requires the answer to mention that the Northern Ireland Protocol (which the Windsor Framework amends/replaces aspects of) declared there would be 'no hard border' on the island of Ireland, phrased as 'no customs or regulatory checks' or 'related physical infrastructure'. The candidate answer addresses the core issue by stating that under the Framework, goods can move freely between NI and the Republic of Ireland without checks at the border, which directly relates to the 'no hard border' principle established by the Protocol that the Framework seeks to manage. Furthermore, the candidate answer correctly identifies the Northern Ireland Protocol as a primary source document.", "criterion_id": "7316dd03-d67f-4ccb-8ed0-ceee41fa529a"}
